values:
This is my contirbution to make known the ONE campaign to fight poverty in the world. Please visit http://www.bread.org/ for more info on this organisation. We just need awareness. Even Sakurai Sho has this band and he wore it during the ONE Concert! Scroll down for recent entries.
Arashi Fans Locations

Well, its been a long, long time since I was really active in the Arashi Fan community. Haven't been keeping up with anything or any of my fellow fans either.

So, I created a chat server with Discord. Anyone interested in chatting about Arashi is welcome to join me there. I may not be online all the time but you're all welcome to drop in for a chat. To share news or links or anything at all about Arashi.

The invite is https://discord.gg/0xJIZBZudWyjpQ2z

Hope to see you all there.

That's such a sad topic for the new year. We are now a decade into the new century and yet we see war among countries every day. When I think that we have people dying due to conflicts and religious disagreement that makes it even more sad. From a personal grudge which escalates into countries fighting each other, one wonders when there will truly be peace among mankind.

In this site http://americanhistory.about.com/library/timelines/bltimelineuswars.htm I noticed that the American troops have been involved in so many wars over the past century. If you notice there is a war of some sort in every decade. Are we not tired of fighting everyday?

Why can't conflicts be resolved peacefully? Why can't people throw away their weapons? Why can't we have happiness instead of sadness? In the face of these why can't people just live doing things that is profitable to oneself instead of causing losses to others?

No wonder most people seek out fleeting moments of joy, even though they know its an illusion to escape the realities of life. Can one truly say I've lived a satisfying life at the twilight of ones life?

Escapism takes many forms and I think I'll continue reading, watching animes, dramas and of course my most important cuties Arashi being their usual selves to start off the next decade. Speaking of which the Kouhaku last year ROCKS!! The battle of the sexes with a lovely Arashi twist.

And now for other news .... I'm freezing!!!!

As the leaves turn colour with the onset of cold... I feel kinda sad to see my plants dying. It's a good thing I also have house plants that I could bring into the apartment to tide over the coming winter. So to that end I bought a new trellis to accommodate my hanging plants and and other herbs and warm climate plants. Now my friends says I've turned my cave into a jungle.

It's been more than a year since I last updated on my garden. I'm very pleased with my garden this year. I've added more plants and the ones from last year that survived over the last brutally cold winter is doing well. Of course I plan to add more plants in fall so that I'll have flowers blooming from February till late September next year. But for this year, the plants started blooming from May till now. Even the blueberries have fruits this year which have yet to be molested by the resident squirrels and chipmunks. My garden soil is well aerated by the resident crayfishes. When I first started planting in the fall of 2007, I noticed slender holes appearing all over the garden especially in the area right under the window. I finally found out that it was made by a family of crayfish. Nowadays I just fill up the holes with the clay thay dug up.

As I tend to my garden I'm also learning about the plants that I've chosen for my perennial garden. I'm still adhering to my plans for a blue and white garden although some of the flowers that bloom are not as blue as I hope but is more purple or lilac in colour. Well, as long as it is not true red or yellow or orange I'm fine with it. Except for the patch of day lilies that were already there when I first moved in (that one is orangey in colour) I am well pleased with my selections.

This year the plants are more lush than last year and I'm having lots of fun watching it grow. Moreover with more plants, I've cut down on the space that requires weeding.

And I have no idea why there is such a huge blank space between this paragraph and the pics.

In late fall I cleared out my patch of dirt of weeds and rubbish. Then I scattered grass seeds to cover up the mud. I should have realised that the ground was muddy and added some sort of top soil to it, but I didn't. It does not matter, the grass took root and flourished. I'm having a tiring time trimming the grass this spring. No regrets however since it looks so much better than the mini jungle that was growing then.

I even spent some time digging the soil and repotting the plants that I bought from the nursery. Sad to say, not all survived the winter. But those that did, they are growing again after lying dormant. This spring I've added more plants to the garden. Over the past few weeks, I've been repotting and clearing weeds. Today I trimmed the grass andhave the sore fingers to testify to the hard work of cutting grass with a pair of scissors.

Yume had a wonderful time sunning herself on the patio. It's too bad the bunny that usually comes to visit didn't appear today. After all the hardwork, the sun was still shining so I took a few pictures of my haven. I'm still pining for a water feature in the garden, maybe I'll think of something over the next month.

Ferrari and Kimi Raikkonnen won the 2007 F1 World Chmapions. My heart when doki-doki so many times over the entire race. I'm really glad that Kimi won the World Championship in his first season with Ferrari.

Although a lot of controversies happened with McLaren, but I do think Ferrari is a good team team orders not withstanding. Their teamwork is great. I'm very happy that Kimi was gracious and thanked the entire team.

Felipe Massa~~~ is a wonderful driver too. The best part about Felipe and Massa is that they started of as rookies with the then Sauber Petronas team. So glad that they are now in Ferrari.

Yoshi, today have been a very productive day. I'd spent 2 hours at the nursery and came home with 12 pots of plants. I've decided to have a blue and silver themed garden. The flowers that will bloom next summer will all be in different shades of blue, violet or lavender. All ore-sama's colours.

I got a butterfly bush which will grow up to 4 feet in height which will have blue sprays. This I've set it in a corner of the garden. 2 shrubs of Russian Sage is planted in between 2 different types of lavender. The Russian Sage will grow pale lavender coloured spires with pale silvery gray leaves that will be glowy in the twilight.

My favourite scents are lavender so of course I have to grow them in my garden, right? I got 4 shrubs of 2 different variety. One is called Munstead Lavender and the other is Hidcote Lavender. Both have feather like silvery leaves but 2 different shades of lavender coloured flowers.

Those shrubs I've planted them near the fence where it will catch the most sunlight which I hope will be enough as my apartment does not get much sun. In contrast to that, I've also gotten 2 varieties of Hostas which are great plants for shaded areas. These are seedings and I hope they will grow well under my window ledge. Hostas are pretty leafy plants. These have lilac coloured flowers and white edges to the leaves. My neighbour have a very lovely bush. I should have asked him for some cuttings but I've not seen him around for sometime.

Then along the edges of the other side of my patio, I've planted 2 small Liriope Varigated grass shrubs. These have long yellowish green leaves and again purple coloured spired flowers. I'll plant moe of these when they grow so that they'll make great borders.

Finally I got 2 tiny pots of ferns and ivy for my shelves. They are so cute. If they grow better, I'll transplant them outside in spring. For now, I've got my tiny garden started. I was very tempted to buy the Flowering Cherry Tree. I'll think about it and may go get it next weekend. If I do get them, I'll be able to experience "Hanami" next spring. No need to travel to Japan. ^_^

I'm still contemplating digging a hole in the garden to put in a pond, but that will require a lot of work which I'm not prepared to do yet. The pond will have to be at least 4 feet in length and have an irregular outline and at least 2 feet in depth. Or I might get lazy and just get one of those ready made ponds but I'm still thinking how to make it look all natural and not stick out like a sore thumb. Another issue of concern is that the pond must be self irrigated. Which means I don't want any wires and pumps running in it or out of it. Hmmm, I do want some water lilies in it too. Purple or white coloured water lilies will complement the theme I've established.

Well, that's it for now. Let's all pray that the plants will thrive and not die as I do not have a green thumb. "Ganbatte my plants"

YAY, so I finally made good on my promise to get the DVD set for HYD. I waited to order the HK version which has English subs. Received it together with my Happiness single. Though the English subs are not excellent it was a commendable effort, My peeve with it is that it's not very grammatically correct. I've found most fansubs to have better quality subs. But that is not the reason I got the DVD set. I got it because it is something that I've wanted to add to my HYD collection. Now I'll wait for the English subbed version of the HYD2 DVD set to be released before I purchase it

I could rip the files for anyone who wants them. Just leave me a note. Since I'm not very knowledgeable about ripping the subs out, you might have to wait a bit while I do some research in that area.

Today have been a really lazy day. I decided to sleep in and then watched HYD. half way through, I decided to clean up my magazines rack and threw out all those irrelevant magazines. Tomorrow I'll most probably take it all to the recycle bin. I tried cooking the croquette that Jun cooked in Kiddies Bangohan for last Saturday. I think I shippaied. The potatoes that I got are not the fluffy kind and I can't mash them properly. So tomorrow it's back to the grocers to get the correct type of potato for mashing. In the mean time the cooked veggies are cooling in the fridge.

Lately I've been experimenting with some of the recipes that I've seen them cook in Kiddies Bangohan and also the dishes that I deem edible from Shukudai-kun. Bought the Kiwano melon that I saw in Kun and it's now chiling in the fridge. Will cut it up and eat it with my ice cream for dessert later.

Now, it's back to HYD. Domyoji Tsukasa still wins over Hanazawa Rui anytime for me.

Looks like half of my drug-induced dreams are coming true. Refer to my earlier post. Anyway, Aiba-chan will be staring in a stage play in October - November as announced in Sanpo.com.

http://www.sanspo.com/geino/top/gt200707/gt2007071901.html

The title of the play is Wasurerarenai Hito, based om the US movie Untamed Heart which stared Christian Slater. The sypnosis for the movie is as follows:

"All of Caroline's boyfriends seem to leave her or cheat on her. On her way home from work two men try to rape Caroline. An introverted man from her work, Adam, rescues her. Adam is an orphan and he is told that he's got a baboon's heart. Adam opens up to Caroline and together they make sense. Adam and Caroline are very happy together but the rapists try to get back at Adam and not everyone accepts an outcast like Adam."

Aiba-chan will star as Adam and Natsuki Kato as Caroline. 

This should be interesting. At last something more for our Super Idol. Now I'm waiting for the last member to announce something significant. It better be something good!
